subject: Sales
title: Active Listening vs. Passive Hearing
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Active Listening vs. Passive Hearing.

hook.text: You're on a call but already planning your response while the buyer talks. That's hearing, not listening.

buildup.text: Active listening means fully processing what someone says, not just waiting for your turn to speak.

discovery.text: It means paraphrasing and confirming: 'So what I'm hearing is...' That phrase changes conversations.

twist.text: Active listening is exhausting. It demands genuine focus in an era of constant digital distraction.

climax.text: Buyers feel the difference instantly. When truly heard, resistance drops and openness increases.

punchline.text: Hearing is automatic. Listening is a deliberate choice.

quiz.question: What distinguishes active listening from passive hearing?
options: Fully processing and paraphrasing what the speaker says
